<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/02/unemployment-claims-near-10m-last-two-weeks-march?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Chart Is Back...and It's Worse Than Last Week
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jobless claims chart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTAvam9ibGVzc19jbGFpbXNfY2hhcnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/jobless-claims-leap-record-66-million-at-end-of-march-as-coronavirus-triggers-mass-layoffs-2020-04-02?mod=home-page" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MarketWatch</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. labor market woke up from a weeklong nightmare to a real-life horror story. In the last two weeks of March, nearly 10 million Americans filed for unemployment, about 6% of the total workforce. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A record 3.3 million claims <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/33m-americans-filed-unemployment-last-week?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> the week ending March 21 practically crashed data visualization tools. But yesterday’s news that <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/02/825383525/6-6-million-file-for-unemployment-another-dismal-record?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">6.6 million claims were filed</a> last week had economists toppling out of their ergonomic spinny chairs.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Wrap your head around this</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If the number of people who filed claims in the last two weeks of March formed a U.S. state, it’d be the 11th largest behind Michigan. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The hardest hit?</strong> Jobless claims in New Hampshire, Indiana, North Carolina, Michigan, and Louisiana rose 4,000% or more. In terms of actual volume, over 878,000 Californians, 366,000 New Yorkers, and almost 406,000 Pennsylvanians filed. Ohio logged more claims in the last two weeks than it did in all of 2019. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While the pandemic initially whacked sectors like tourism and hospitality, job cuts are now getting deeper in industries that had been more shielded, like education, healthcare, law, and tech. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One silverish lining: As part of the rescue package, the government is allowing more types of workers to apply for pandemic relief funds, such as independent contractors and the self-employed. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unemployment numbers could get worse. Just this week, over 300,000 retail workers <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/04/01/furloughs-sweep-retailers-department-stores-mall-operators?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were furloughed</a>. And the St. Louis Fed recently <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/coronavirus-job-losses-could-total-47-million-unemployment-rate-may-n1172111?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicted</a> job losses could total 47 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The March jobs report will be released this morning, but it’ll paint an <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/02/economy/march-jobs-report-preview/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">incomplete</a> picture since surveys were conducted the second week of March (before all those record unemployment claims). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The April report should provide a better indicator of how the pandemic has affected the U.S. job market. Citi economists told CNN they predict 10 million lost jobs this month and unemployment rising above 10%. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/02/trump-says-putin-mbs-will-cut-oil-supply?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Game of Telephone Shocks Oil Markets Back to Life
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="President Trump's tweet about Putin and MBS " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDcvdHJ1bXBfb2lsX3R3ZWV0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>@realDonaldTrump</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oil prices had their best day ever following President Trump’s tweetnouncement that the power brokers of the global oil industry—Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and Russian President Vladimir Putin—appear to be <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-global-oil-saudi-russia/trump-says-he-brokered-deal-with-saudi-russia-for-huge-oil-cuts-idUSKBN21K0EA?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">working together</a> on dramatic supply cuts.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Axios’s Felix Salmon </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/felixsalmon/status/1245733530291888135?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mused</a></span><span>, “In terms of dollar value of assets affected, is this the most market-moving tweet of all time?”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's certainly a significant development. Remember, last month’s OPEC+ meeting ended in chaos when the Russians and Saudis couldn’t agree to extend or deepen existing supply cuts. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What happened next:</strong></span><span> The Saudis </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched a price war</a></span><span>, global demand collapsed because of the coronavirus, and oil prices plunged to their lowest level since 2002.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In some corners of the market, oil prices are actually </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-04-02/negative-oil-prices-are-already-here-as-storage-fills-up?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">negative</a></span><span> as storage runs out. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>two things: 1) the Saudi government is reportedly calling for an emergency OPEC+ meeting and 2) Trump will meet with major oil execs at the White House today to discuss the challenges facing the industry.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/02/companies-donate-help-import-masks-medical-supplies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Ask Is for Masks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nurse in an N95 mask" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTEvbnVyc2VfaW5fYW5fbjk1X21hc2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>BRYAN R. SMITH/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Healthcare providers in the U.S. are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/article/face-masks-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">facing a scarcity</a> of medical supplies—especially N95 masks, which are essential to keeping workers and patients safe. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Many of those supplies are manufactured in China, where factories went offline for several weeks. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So companies are helping out </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Home Depot </strong>said it has stopped selling N95 masks entirely and donated its stock to hospitals, first responders, and other healthcare providers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Amazon</strong> barred consumers from purchasing N95 masks, testing kits, and some other medical supplies on its site. It created a new site for hospitals and government agencies instead. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Last but not least, </strong>when<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Massachusetts Gov. Charlie Baker was scrambling for supplies, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-million-n95-masks-are-coming-from-chinaon-board-the-new-england-patriots-plane-11585821600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he tapped</a> his friend Jonathan Kraft—son of Robert, president of the New England Patriots, chair of the Massachusetts General Hospital board, and Viceroy of Greater Bostonland. Kraft came through in spectacular fashion this week, importing 1.2 million masks from China in the Patriots' jet. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">These really are extraordinary times. </strong>Red Sox fan Kraft donated 300,000 masks to New York.</p>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Coffee" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTQvbHVja2luLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We all bend the truth sometimes, from “I prefer my coffee black” to “I left your play because it was <em>too</em> moving.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But yesterday, Luckin Coffee admitted to a real humdinger. The Chinese coffee chain said its COO and several other employees <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/02/luckin-coffee-stock-plummets-after-investigation-finds-coo-fabricated-sales.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fabricated 2019 sales numbers</a>. They’ve been suspended, and the company plans to bring legal action. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Luckin reported about $413 million in net revenue for the first nine months of 2019—but now says those numbers shouldn’t be trusted. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Luckin backstory: </strong>Luckin was once among the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/luckin-coffee-accuses-operating-chief-of-financial-misconduct-11585840274?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hottest startups</a>, going public in 2019 less than two years after it was founded. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Luckin’s market cap was over $6 billion before yesterday, and the company hoped to overtake Starbucks in China by the end of 2020. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The fishy numbers backstory: </strong>In January, Muddy Waters Research said it was <a href="https://twitter.com/muddywatersre/status/1223274746017722371?lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shorting Luckin stock</a> based on an anonymous report. Luckin said the report was false, and investors were mostly unmoved...until yesterday, when shares dropped more than 75%.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The videoconferencing company Zoom has become our collective virtual reality. </strong>In December 2019, the platform had a maximum of 10 million daily participants. Last month, it hit more than 200 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That astonishing growth has come with serious concerns over privacy. In a <a href="https://blog.zoom.us/wordpress/2020/04/01/a-message-to-our-users/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blog post</a> Wednesday, CEO Eric Yuan said he’s enacting a 90-day “feature freeze” to devote all engineering resources to privacy and security. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We know a lot of Morning Brew readers are using Zoom for more than just work meetings. So, we tossed the question out on social media: How are you using Zoom in your social life? The responses are both heartwarming and hilarious. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/02/32-ways-people-using-zoom-besides-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read the list here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/02/morning-brews-daily-quarantine-planner-april-3?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Daily Quarantine Planner: April 3
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These recommendations from the Brew's Eliza Carter are excellent, but you don't have to click a single link to enjoy her writing. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/athletic-shoe_1f45f.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Morning workout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get a free week or two of <a href="https://www.corepoweryoga.com/yoga-on-demand?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CorePower</a> or <a href="https://www.glo.com/yoga-online?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Glo</a> yoga. All of our third eyes could use some tending to—the first two are reading a lot of bad news. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Work <strong style="color:#000">soundtrack </strong>
</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you 1) prefer downbeat work music and 2) miss 2018, I recommend revisiting two albums from that year: Mac Miller’s <em><a href="https://open.spotify.com/album/5wtE5aLX5r7jOosmPhJhhk?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Swimming</a></em> and Kacey Musgraves’s <a href="https://open.spotify.com/album/7f6xPqyaolTiziKf5R5Z0c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Golden</em> <em>Hour</em></a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/green-salad_1f957.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Lunch, but make it productive</strong></h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Level up:</strong> Phase 1: Listen to the <em><a href="http://philosophizethis.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Philosophize This!</a></em> podcast. Phase 2: Drop post-structuralist theory into conversation. Phase 3: Win heart of cute, brainy barista. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Do good:</strong> Publishers Weekly has a <a href="https://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/authors/interviews/article/82703-15-books-and-authors-hurt-by-the-coronavirus.html?consumer&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">list of books and authors</a> affected by the coronavirus. Order a book, read it, and if you like it, tell the author. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stay up-to-date: </strong><a href="https://popular.info/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Popular Information</a> is an excellent newsletter by investigative journalist Judd Legum.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/video-camera_1f4f9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Things to send your group chat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We may be in a global pandemic, but quarantines can’t stop a fun mom from fun momming. This one did probably the <a href="https://twitter.com/MixedUpMoney/status/1245392783763886086?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only good April Fool’s prank ever</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Dinner plans </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Make shrimp and grits. It’s comfort food with vitamins tucked between the butter and cheese. Here’s a <a href="https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/10718-shrimp-and-grits?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times recipe</a> and <a href="https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a24489868/easy-shrimp-and-grits-recipe/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">another</a> without a paywall. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The secret: Put milk or cream (or your non-dairy alternative of choice) in the shrimp mixture. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Evening <strong style="color:#000">activity</strong>
</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen: </strong>Finally teach your dog to shake hands. The American Kennel Club has a <a href="https://www.akc.org/expert-advice/training/how-to-teach-your-dog-to-shake-hands/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">list of tips here</a> but I suspect peanut butter is the only tip you need. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen: </strong>Watch <em>Mad Men</em>'s Season Two finale, “<a href="https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1118055/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Meditations in an Emergency</a>.” Set during the Cuban Missile Crisis, it will bring you to a moment when Americans really believed their world could be obliterated overnight. But we pulled through. </p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_042020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomic relief: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. government will begin making \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/58fd3ecc3c35e191e04a880a849b8d63?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirect payments\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to Americans in mid-April, per a memo reviewed by the AP. But some without direct deposit may not get checks until August or later…\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMeanwhile,\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the small business lending program from the rescue package is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/02/jpmorgan-says-its-not-ready-for-small-business-loan-applications-as-banks-await-treasury-guidance.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset to go live today\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, but banks say they're not ready.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/oil-jump-lifts-wall-street-as-jobless-claims-data-surges-idUSKBN21K1ET?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehistoric day for oil prices\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e lifted stocks across the board. You’ll read about what happened in just a minute.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nWORK \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/02/unemployment-claims-near-10m-last-two-weeks-march?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThis Chart Is Back...and It's Worse Than Last Week\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Jobless claims chart\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTAvam9ibGVzc19jbGFpbXNfY2hhcnQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/jobless-claims-leap-record-66-million-at-end-of-march-as-coronavirus-triggers-mass-layoffs-2020-04-02?mod=home-page\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMarketWatch\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. labor market woke up from a weeklong nightmare to a real-life horror story. In the last two weeks of March, nearly 10 million Americans filed for unemployment, about 6% of the total workforce. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA record 3.3 million claims \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/33m-americans-filed-unemployment-last-week?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled\u003c/a\u003e the week ending March 21 practically crashed data visualization tools. But yesterday’s news that \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/02/825383525/6-6-million-file-for-unemployment-another-dismal-record?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e6.6 million claims were filed\u003c/a\u003e last week had economists toppling out of their ergonomic spinny chairs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWrap your head around this\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf the number of people who filed claims in the last two weeks of March formed a U.S. state, it’d be the 11th largest behind Michigan. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe hardest hit?\u003c/strong\u003e Jobless claims in New Hampshire, Indiana, North Carolina, Michigan, and Louisiana rose 4,000% or more. In terms of actual volume, over 878,000 Californians, 366,000 New Yorkers, and almost 406,000 Pennsylvanians filed. Ohio logged more claims in the last two weeks than it did in all of 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile the pandemic initially whacked sectors like tourism and hospitality, job cuts are now getting deeper in industries that had been more shielded, like education, healthcare, law, and tech. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne silverish lining: As part of the rescue package, the government is allowing more types of workers to apply for pandemic relief funds, such as independent contractors and the self-employed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnemployment numbers could get worse. Just this week, over 300,000 retail workers \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/04/01/furloughs-sweep-retailers-department-stores-mall-operators?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere furloughed\u003c/a\u003e. And the St. Louis Fed recently \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/coronavirus-job-losses-could-total-47-million-unemployment-rate-may-n1172111?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicted\u003c/a\u003e job losses could total 47 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe March jobs report will be released this morning, but it’ll paint an \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/02/economy/march-jobs-report-preview/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincomplete\u003c/a\u003e picture since surveys were conducted the second week of March (before all those record unemployment claims). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe April report should provide a better indicator of how the pandemic has affected the U.S. job market. Citi economists told CNN they predict 10 million lost jobs this month and unemployment rising above 10%. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOil prices had their best day ever following President Trump’s tweetnouncement that the power brokers of the global oil industry—Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and Russian President Vladimir Putin—appear to be \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-global-oil-saudi-russia/trump-says-he-brokered-deal-with-saudi-russia-for-huge-oil-cuts-idUSKBN21K0EA?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworking together\u003c/a\u003e on dramatic supply cuts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAxios’s Felix Salmon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/felixsalmon/status/1245733530291888135?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid time?”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's certainly a significant development. Remember, last month’s OPEC+ meeting ended in chaos when the Russians and Saudis couldn’t agree to extend or deepen existing supply cuts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened next:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The Saudis \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/08/saudi-arabia-launches-oil-price-war-opec-meeting?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched a price war\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, global demand collapsed because of the coronavirus, and oil prices plunged to their lowest level since 2002.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn some corners of the market, oil prices are actually \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-04-02/negative-oil-prices-are-already-here-as-storage-fills-up?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enegative\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e as storage runs out. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBRYAN R. SMITH/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHealthcare providers in the U.S. are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/article/face-masks-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efacing a scarcity\u003c/a\u003e of medical supplies—especially N95 masks, which are essential to keeping workers and patients safe. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMany of those supplies are manufactured in China, where factories went offline for several weeks. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo companies are helping out \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHome Depot \u003c/strong\u003esaid it has stopped selling N95 masks entirely and donated its stock to hospitals, first responders, and other healthcare providers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon\u003c/strong\u003e barred consumers from purchasing N95 masks, testing kits, and some other medical supplies on its site. It created a new site for hospitals and government agencies instead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLast but not least, \u003c/strong\u003ewhen\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eMassachusetts Gov. Charlie Baker was scrambling for supplies, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/a-million-n95-masks-are-coming-from-chinaon-board-the-new-england-patriots-plane-11585821600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe tapped\u003c/a\u003e his friend Jonathan Kraft—son of Robert, president of the New England Patriots, chair of the Massachusetts General Hospital board, and Viceroy of Greater Bostonland. Kraft came through in spectacular fashion this week, importing 1.2 million masks from China in the Patriots' jet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThese really are extraordinary times. \u003c/strong\u003eRed Sox fan Kraft donated 300,000 masks Luckin Coffee admitted to a real humdinger. The Chinese coffee chain said its COO and several other employees \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/02/luckin-coffee-stock-plummets-after-investigation-finds-coo-fabricated-sales.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efabricated 2019 sales numbers\u003c/a\u003e. They’ve been suspended, and the company plans to bring legal action. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLuckin reported about $413 million in net revenue for the first nine months of 2019—but now says those numbers shouldn’t be trusted. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Luckin backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eLuckin was once among the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/luckin-coffee-accuses-operating-chief-of-financial-misconduct-11585840274?mod=lead_feature_below_a_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehottest startups\u003c/a\u003e, going public in 2019 less than two years after it was founded. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLuckin’s market cap was over $6 billion before yesterday, and the company hoped to overtake Starbucks in China by the end of 2020. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe fishy numbers backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn January, Muddy Waters Research said it was \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/muddywatersre/status/1223274746017722371?lang=en\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshorting Luckin stock\u003c/a\u003e based on an anonymous report.
